intro: Hieracium venustulum, commonly known as the pretty hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has hairy stems and leaves. Hieracium venustulum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a common weed in some areas.
